definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: "Not a word of it, " said Marvel , stoutly .
sentences.chinese: “沒有一句真話，”馬弗爾斷然說道。

sentences.english: We plunked squarely down on the side of the government.
sentences.chinese: 我們斷然宣稱自己站在政府一邊。

sentences.english: The check with boyfriend gayle angry, flatly rejected participate in singing.
sentences.chinese: 阿帕查由於和男朋友格利生氣，斷然回絕參與演唱。

sentences.english: The norwegians and danes flatly rejected the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 挪威人和丹麥人斷然地駁回了證詞。
他的請求遭到了斷然拒絕。

sentences.english: But ministers flatly turned down the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 但是大臣們斷然拒絕了這一提議。

sentences.english: The salesman flatly refuses to match the lower price, citing store policy.
sentences.chinese: 售貨員斷然拒絕了按底價出售，並說明了店裏的規矩。

sentences.english: "We can't go without Snoopy, "Jodi stated flatly.
sentences.chinese: “我們不能撂下斯努皮，”約迪斷然說道。

sentences.english: Their propaganda was peremptorily switched to an anti-western line .
sentences.chinese: 他們的宣傳斷然地轉而持反對西方的路線。

sentences.english: From our point of view, the best plan would be to take a drastic measure.
sentences.chinese: 從我們的觀點來看，最好的方法就是採取斷然措施。

sentences.english: She repulsed his offer of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她斷然拒絕了他的求婚。

sentences.english: The president seems almost perversely out of touch.
sentences.chinese: 總統似乎是斷然地失去了聯繫。

sentences.english: Positivism flatly denies that any field of inquiry is open for teleological research.
sentences.chinese: 實證主義斷然否定那些採用目的論做研究的領域。

sentences.english: The government is threatening to take drastic action.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告說要採取斷然措施。

definition: to turn a blind eye to
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to be determined to/to insist on
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
